ygData.subject: Re: Cross-class research?
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t see why you couldn t MAKE another spellcaster s spells, but I see you NOT being able to use them.  This is what I was thinking for a competent
ygData.messageBody:
I don't see why you couldn't MAKE another spellcaster's spells, but
I see you NOT being able to use them. This is what I was thinking for a
competent spellcaster tradeskill. Yo spent platinum and practice points
learning how to research, then go out and buy all the books, tireless gather
runes and words and pages and then make spells for OTHER spellcasters at
something of a profit (really though researched spells would definitely be
worth more than their vended counterparts. I could see 50 plat for a spell
whose other circle spells are sold for 22 plat easily, if not more. I know
_I_ would pay at least that much to not have to deal with Research. ;)

Malark on Karana
PS - Will buy Hungry Earth, give me a price. ;)

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Windows/BrownG/bryson On Behalf Of Valacian
> Sent: Wednesday, May 12, 1999 10:12 AM
> To: 'EQ_spell_research@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [EQ_spell_research] Cross-class research?
>
> I'm going to assume this is just a rumor. I wouldn't see the point of
building another mage type except Wizard if this were true. That would kind
of throw the balance of character classes off a bit. Wizard's would be
everywhere! I could be wrong.....
>
> Valacian - 22nd Level Erudite Wizard, Xegony
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: VorteksJRC@... [SMTP:VorteksJRC@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 11, 1999 6:25 PM
> To: EQ_spell_research@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_spell_research] Cross-class research?
>
> From: VorteksJRC@...
>
> That would be very cool. As a magician I am very envious over the
wizzards
> location-specific gate spells. Let me know what you find out.
>
>
>
> In a message dated 5/11/99 2:46:06 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
> ecoyle@... writes:
>
> << 've heard rumors that it's possible for a wizard, through
research, to
> learn spells that would otherwise be available only to other
classes. For
> example, I am hoping this is the case with my Wizard, I want to
learn SoW
> desperately (don't we all?).
>
> SOE needs to do a better job of explaining research. ;)
> >>
>
>
